items.label: def-cg-algorithmic-force
items.title: Algorithmic Force
items.content:
16: :label: def-cg-algorithmic-force
17: 
18: For walker $i$ undergoing geometric ascent ({prf:ref}`def-cg-ascent-operator`), the **algorithmic force** is
19: 
20: $$
21: F_i := \eta \cdot H_{\Phi}(x_i)^{-1} \Delta x_i \in \mathbb{R}^{d}
22: $$
23: 
24: where:
25: - $\Delta x_i = x_{j^*(i)} - x_i$ is the displacement toward the best companion
26: - $H_{\Phi}(x_i)^{-1}$ is the inverse Hessian (exists by {prf:ref}`def-cg-fitness-landscape`)
27: - $\eta \in (0,1]$ is the step size parameter

items.content:
33: :label: def-cg-momentum

items.title: Companion Direction Vector
items.content:
43: :label: def-cg-companion-direction
44: 
45: For walker $i$ with companion $j^*(i)$ (from {prf:ref}`def-cg-ascent-operator`), define:
46: - **Direction vector:**
47: 
48: $$
49: \hat{r}_{i,j^*(i)} := \frac{x_{j^*(i)} - x_i}{\|x_{j^*(i)} - x_i\|} \in S^{d-1}
50: $$
51: 
52: - **Companion distance:**
53: 
54: $$
55: d_{i,j^*(i)} := \|x_{j^*(i)} - x_i\|
56: $$
57: 
58: - **Fitness score:**
59: 
60: $$
61: S_{\text{ascent}}(i \to j^*(i)) := \frac{\Phi(x_{j^*(i)}) - \Phi(x_i)}{\Phi(x_i) + \varepsilon_{\text{reg}}}
62: $$

91:

items.label: def-cg-traceless-projection
items.title: Traceless Projection to SU(3)
items.content:
106: :label: def-cg-traceless-projection
107: 
108: To obtain an SU(3)-valued object (which must be traceless), we define:
109: 
110: $$
111: T_i^{\text{traceless}} := T_i - \frac{1}{3} \text{Tr}(T_i) \cdot I_3
112: $$
113: 
114: where:
115: - $\text{Tr}(T_i) = \sum_{a=1}^{3} (T_i)_{aa} = F_i \cdot p_i$ (dot product)
116: - $I_3$ is the $3 \times 3$ identity matrix

items.label: def-cg-su3-gauge-field
items.title: SU(3) Color Gauge Field (Gluons)
items.content:
160: :label: def-cg-su3-gauge-field
161: 
162: The **SU(3) color gauge potential** for the Crystalline Gas is defined as the Lie-algebra-valued 1-form:
163: 
164: $$
165: \mathcal{A}_{\mu}^{\text{color}}(x) := \sum_{a=1}^{8} A_{\mu}^a(x) \cdot \lambda^a \in \mathfrak{su}(3) \otimes T^*M
166: $$
167: 
168: where the individual gluon field components are:
169: 
170: $$
171: A_{\mu}^a(x) := \partial_{\mu} \varphi^a(x)
172: $$
173: 
174: Here:
175: - $\varphi^a(x)$ is the spatial field obtained by interpolating the discrete walker phases $\varphi_i^a$

items.label: def-cg-u1-phase
items.title: U(1) Hypercharge Phase from Fitness
items.content:
412: :label: def-cg-u1-phase
413: 
414: For walker $i$ with fitness $\Phi(x_i)$, define the **hypercharge phase**:
415: 
416: $$
417: \varphi_i^{(Y)} := \Phi(x_i)
418: $$
419: 
420: Alternatively, for better normalization, use the **regularized fitness**:
421: 
422: $$
423: \varphi_i^{(Y)} := \frac{\Phi(x_i) - \langle \Phi \rangle}{\sigma_{\Phi}} + \eta
424: $$
425: 
426: where:
427: - $\langle \Phi \rangle$ is the mean fitness over all walkers
428: - $\sigma_{\Phi}$ is the standard deviation
429: - $\eta > 0$ is a small regularization constant

items.label: def-cg-gauge-transformation
items.title: Local Gauge Transformation
items.content:
576: :label: def-cg-gauge-transformation
577: 
578: A **local gauge transformation** is a spacetime-dependent group element:
579: 
580: $$
581: g(x) \in G_{\text{gauge}} = \text{SU}(3) \times \text{SU}(2) \times \text{U}(1)
582: $$
583: 
584: Under such a transformation:
585: 
586: **SU(3) color:**
587: $$
588: c(x) \to U_3(x) c(x), \quad U_3 \in \text{SU}(3)
589: $$
590: 
591: **SU(2) weak isospin:**
592: $$
593: \psi_L(x) \to U_2(x) \psi_L(x), \quad U_2 \in \text{SU}(2)
594: $$
595: 
596: **U(1) hypercharge:**
597: $$
598: \psi(x) \to e^{i Y \alpha(x)} \psi(x), \quad \alpha(x) \in \mathbb{R}
599: $$
items.section: ## 4. Emergence of SU(2) × SU(3) Gauge Symmetry and Pure Yang-Mills Dynamics

items.label: def-cg-field-strength
items.title: Field Strength Tensors
items.content:
703: :label: def-cg-field-strength
704: 
705: For each gauge group, the **field strength tensor** (curvature) is:
706: 
707: **SU(3)_c:**
708: $$
709: F_{\mu\nu}^a = \partial_{\mu} A_{\nu}^a - \partial_{\nu} A_{\mu}^a + g_s \sum_{bc} f^{abc} A_{\mu}^b A_{\nu}^c
710: $$
711: 
712: where $f^{abc}$ are the SU(3) structure constants.
713: 
714: **SU(2)_L:**
715: $$
716: W_{\mu\nu}^a = \partial_{\mu} W_{\nu}^a - \partial_{\nu} W_{\mu}^a + g_2 \sum_{bc} \varepsilon^{abc} W_{\mu}^b W_{\nu}^c
717: $$
718: 
719: where $\varepsilon^{abc}$ is the Levi-Civita symbol (SU(2) structure constants).
720: 
721: **U(1)_Y:**
722: $$
723: F_{\mu\nu}^{(Y)} = \partial_{\mu} A_{\nu}^{(Y)} - \partial_{\nu} A_{\mu}^{(Y)}
724: $$
items.section: ## 4. Emergence of SU(2) × SU(3) Gauge Symmetry and Pure Yang-Mills Dynamics

items.label: def-cg-yang-mills-equations
items.title: Yang-Mills Equations
items.content:
730: :label: def-cg-yang-mills-equations
731: 
732: The **Yang-Mills equations** with matter source $J^{\mu}$ are:
733: 
734: $$
735: D_{\mu} F^{\mu\nu} = J^{\nu}
736: $$
737: 
738: where $D_{\mu}$ is the **gauge-covariant derivative**:
739: 
740: $$
741: D_{\mu} = \partial_{\mu} + i g_s \sum_a A_{\mu}^a \lambda^a + i g_2 \sum_a W_{\mu}^a \tau^a + i g_1 A_{\mu}^{(Y)} Y
742: $$
743: 
744: For a **pure gauge theory** (no matter), the source vanishes:
745: 
746: $$
747: J^{\mu} = 0 \implies D_{\mu} F^{\mu\nu} = 0
748: $$
